matklad said:

it should be "there are mentoring instructions"

Late to the party but we did rename E-menotor to E-has-instructions because of this in rust-analyzer

are there any objections to doing this in rust-lang/rust? I think it describes the goal more clearly
unsure what's the process for this kind of changes to be honest

What expectation are you intending to set? The change sounds to me like "here are some instructions, good luck".

Is there a concern for the amount of time required to actually mentor the contributor through resolving the issue?

If the goal is to limit the time requirement for the mentor through to issue completion and instead provide a comment with instructions, then definitely remove the word mentor. That change will set the desired expectation. So E-has-instructions would be the better fit.

Hmm, so my initial reaction was "I don't know if people will still be active if you look at an old issue". But if it's so old people might have left the project, then the instructions are probably not relevant anymore. I don't think we can capture that in two words; I would be happy with either mentoring-instructions or has-instructions. I do think mentor on its own is misleading though.
